meanings.definition: A type of freshwater fish with a large, flattened head and spiny fins.
meanings.sent1: The bullheads swam gracefully in the pond.
meanings.sent2: I caught a few bullheads while fishing at the lake.
meanings.sent3: The bullheads had a meeting to discuss the upcoming fish race.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as sharp as the spiny fins of bullheads.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the bullheads' unique appearance.

meanings.sent1: Despite being wrong, the bullheads refused to admit their mistake.
meanings.sent2: The bullheads in the group project made it difficult to reach a consensus.
meanings.sent3: The bullheads stubbornly insisted on taking the longer route.
meanings.sent4: Her father was as stubborn as a bullheads when it came to changing his mind.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with bullheads can be challenging due to their strong-willed nature.
